| A winged pseudodragon:* can [fly](/wiki/Fly "Fly").
* has no hands.
* is [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivore "Carnivore").
* can be [tamed by feeding](/wiki/Domestic "Domestic").
* wanders randomly.
* [likes gold](/wiki/Gold_lover "Gold lover").
* likes gems.
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                                                                                                                                                                         |

A **winged pseudodragon**, D, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"). It is a [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous") and [domestic](/wiki/Domestic "Domestic") [dragon-like](/index.php?title=Dragon_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Dragon (dNetHack) (page does not exist)") creature that is the first stage of [pseudodragon](/wiki/Pseudodragon_\(dNetHack\) "Pseudodragon (dNetHack)") to be capable of [flight](/wiki/Flight "Flight") as its name indicates. Winged pseudodragons also have a tendency to wander, will pick up [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold") and [gems](/wiki/Gem "Gem"), and can be seen via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").

A winged pseudodragon has a bite attack, two claw attacks, and a [breath weapon](/wiki/Breath_weapon "Breath weapon") similar to that of [half-dragons](/wiki/Half-dragon "Half-dragon").

## Generation

Winged pseudodragons are not randomly generated. A [large pseudodragon](/wiki/Large_pseudodragon "Large pseudodragon") can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into a winged pseudodragon, and a winged pseudodragon can grow up into a [huge pseudodragon](/wiki/Huge_pseudodragon "Huge pseudodragon").

## Origin

Pseudodragons originate from *[Dungeons & Dragons](/wiki/Dungeons_%26_Dragons "Dungeons & Dragons")*, where they resemble true dragons in appearance but are usually far smaller and far more docile, which makes them suitable as familiars for wizards. They do not usually grow to the sizes shown in dNetHack and notdNetHack, which rivals that of the true dragons in those variants.

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Winged_pseudodragon\&action=edit)*

html:
Winged pseudodragon

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
D winged pseudodragon (No tile)
Difficulty 18
Attacks Bite 2d6 physical, Claw 1d4 physical, Claw 1d4 physical, Breath weapon 1d6 half-dragon breath
D winged pseudodragon (No tile)
Difficulty 18
Attacks

Bite 2d6 physical, Claw 1d4 physical, Claw 1d4 physical, Breath weapon 1d6 half-dragon breath

Base level 14
Base experience 413
Speed 20
Base AC -2
Base MR 8
Alignment -5 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 3000
Nutritional value 800
Size large

A winged pseudodragon:

  • can fly.
  • has no hands.
  • is carnivorous.
  • can be tamed by feeding.
  • wanders randomly.
  • likes gold.
  • likes gems.
  • can be seen through infravision.

A winged pseudodragon, D, is a type of monster that appears in dNetHack and notdNetHack. It is a carnivorous and domestic dragon-like creature that is the first stage of pseudodragon to be capable of flight as its name indicates. Winged pseudodragons also have a tendency to wander, will pick up gold and gems, and can be seen via infravision.

A winged pseudodragon has a bite attack, two claw attacks, and a breath weapon similar to that of half-dragons.

Generation

Winged pseudodragons are not randomly generated. A large pseudodragon can grow up into a winged pseudodragon, and a winged pseudodragon can grow up into a huge pseudodragon.

Origin

Pseudodragons originate from Dungeons & Dragons, where they resemble true dragons in appearance but are usually far smaller and far more docile, which makes them suitable as familiars for wizards. They do not usually grow to the sizes shown in dNetHack and notdNetHack, which rivals that of the true dragons in those variants.

This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.

A '''winged pseudodragon''', {{brightblue|D}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]]. It is a [[carnivorous]] and [[domestic]] [[Dragon (dNetHack)|dragon-like]] creature that is the first stage of [[Pseudodragon (dNetHack)|pseudodragon]] to be capable of [[flight]] as its name indicates. Winged pseudodragons also have a tendency to wander, will pick up [[gold]] and [[gem]]s, and can be seen via [[infravision]].

A winged pseudodragon has a bite attack, two claw attacks, and a [[breath weapon]] similar to that of [[half-dragon]]s.

==Generation==
Winged pseudodragons are not randomly generated. A [[large pseudodragon]] can [[grow up]] into a winged pseudodragon, and a winged pseudodragon can grow up into a [[huge pseudodragon]].

==Origin==
Pseudodragons originate from ''[[Dungeons & Dragons]]'', where they resemble true dragons in appearance but are usually far smaller and far more docile, which makes them suitable as familiars for wizards. They do not usually grow to the sizes shown in dNetHack and notdNetHack, which rivals that of the true dragons in those variants.
